intro: Hieracium vulgatum subsp. acuminatifolium, commonly known as the sharp-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and lanceolate leaves that are sharply pointed, giving it its common name. Its yellow flowers appear in clusters and bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, often forming dense colonies.
